title: OUT NOW RuneScape: Leagues: CATALYST (RS3)
content:
Our friends on the RS3 team have launched their first League, CATALYST. Here's what you ought to know.





OUT NOW RuneScape: Leagues: CATALYST (RS3)


What is RuneScape: Leagues: CATALYST?



If you've played any of the five OSRS Leagues then you'll be familiar with the concept, but here's the gist of how it'll work in RS3. Alternatively, check out the official Launch blog or the What Is Leagues blog (RS3) for even more detail.




Leagues is a time-limited game mode that lets you start fresh on an alternate version of your character and relive your journey through Gielinor. CATALYST will run from September 15th until November 10th. This is available to all Members (RS3 and OSRS, since membership is shared across characters), with no microtransactions.




This is the RuneScape you know experienced through a new lens - with sky-high XP rates, game-changing relics, a unique set of tasks to conquer - making your adventure more intense than ever. Before long, you’ll be blazing through levels, toppling the toughest bosses, and unleashing epic game changing powers as you tear through your task list.





Playing CATALYST League



There's all sorts of reasons why you might want to play CATALYST: you're desperate to scratch the Leagues itch, you're curious about skills like Archaeology, Invention, or Necromancy, or you might want to try challenging end-game PvM encounters like fighting Zamorak (Yes, you can fight Zamorak!), the Arch-Glacor, or Vorago.




We have the basics of how you can play here but we have to recommend checking out this incredible guide from TheRSGuy. It covers set-up of interfaces, explains combat differences, and even has a Leagues Hub with a Day 1 guide for those of you who find joy in efficiency.




And, of course, the incredible Wiki team have worked their magic to bring you another amazing Leagues hub. It has an interactive task list and an overview of your Relic choices, and way more.




Playing CATALYST will be the easiest Task you come across, it takes no time at all to get stuck in.

Install the RuneScape (RS3) game client - if you're on the Jagex Launcher just navigate to the RS3 menu
Select the character you want to play with
Launch RuneScape (RS3) and from the World selection page choose the Leagues worlds filter and select your world of choice
On logging in you'll see a brief description of CATALYST and how the rewards process works - since you can’t play Leagues and the main game mode simultaneously on the same account, players can nominate which account should receive their Leagues rewards
Choose your character's appearance
Pick an interface layout
Complete the Leagues tutorial in-game and unlock your first Relic
Play CATALYST!




Our friends on the RS3 team have also introduced a promotional Membership Package which spans the entire duration of the League. You can get 57 days of membership for a discounted price! Note that membership applies to your character in either RS3 or OSRS. This offer is available to purchase from today now until 22 September 2025 at 11:00am UTC. Both new and returning members can partake, including those who’ve bought membership with Bonds while the promotion is active but this offer will only appear on Desktop. You can find the deal here at this link, taking you to the Store page and prompting you to login to your game account.






That's it from us! We wish the RuneScape team every success with their first League, and we hope you have fun if you decide to play!




Mods Abe, Abyss, Acorn, Ape, Arcane, Archie, Argo, Ash, Ayiza, BigRig, Blighted, Blossom, Boko, Bruno, Chilly, Criminal, Curse, Daizong, Donkey, Ed, Elena, Enigma, Entropi, Freddie, Fuzz, Gecko, Gengis, Gizmo, Goblin, Grace, Grub, Halo, Harold, Hend, Hornet, Husky, Ivory, Jalo, Jamesy, Jerv, Keyser, Kieren, Kirby, Kurotou, Leebleh, Lenny, Light, Liron, Lykos, Mack, Manked, Markos, Maylea, Mobius, Moogle, Morty, Moz, Necro, Nin, Nixon, Nox, Nylu, Ori, Other, Otter, Philomel, Pork, Pumpkin, Puppi, Rach, Redfield, Rice, Roq, Roy, Ry, Saiyan, Sarnie, Schmidt, Shogun, Shroom, Sigma, Skylark, Smithy, Sova, Spyro, Squid, Starry, Suharun, Surma, Sween, Tide, Titania, Titus, TJ, Tomb, Tsourorf, Tyran, Veda, Vegard, West, Wolfy & Yume

title: A Message about Real World Trading
content:
For as long as RuneScape has been around, a disappointing number of players have sought unfair advantages by buying in-game gold directly off illicit sellers.

This is called Real World Trading, and the game's rules expressly forbid it:

Real World Trading

Real World trading (RWT) means buying or selling in the real world, for real money or in exchange for anything of value, things that relate to Jagex accounts. This includes:

In-game items
In-game Gold (GP)
Account names
   

In addition, paying someone to play your account for you is covered by this rule.




This rule-breaking doesn't just affect the player who's buying the gold. It creates a financial incentive for people who don't care about the game to flood it with bots and throw-away accounts to gather gold to sell. So, when legitimate players gather items to sell on the GE, they'll earn less because the market's affected by botted resources, and playing alongside all the highly visible bots is infuriating!

Our hard-working anti-cheat staff are being aided by analysts and other staff across Jagex to help them clamp down on the bots; that's addressing the supply-side. But we need to address the demand-side too, since the sellers only have an incentive to gather all this wealth because of those players who buy it off them.

Buying gold off a real world trader is already very clearly against the rules, but historically we've treated the buyers more leniently than the sellers when issuing penalties for real world trading. As part of our clamp-down on those gold-farming bots and the harm they do to Old School RuneScape, we're now taking a harsher line against players caught buying gold from them. If you're buying your gold that way, please don't expect to get away with just a warning; our agents will issue bans, temporary or permanent depending on the situation, even for first offenses, as well as confiscating items from the offenders.

Thank you for reading - and thank you for supporting Gielinor and its legitimate players by abiding by the rules as you play!

Jagex Player Support

title: Poll 85 - Bridges, Boots, Ropes & Roots
content:
Known Issues	Status
We’re aware that the new permanent ropes at Baxtorian Falls (after completing Waterfall Quest and the Kandarin Medium Diary), currently skip the plateau needed for the medium clue step.	Hotfixed.
Ground item labels are currently not displaying on the offical client.	Coldfixed.






Bridges, boots, ropes and roots - more Poll 85 changes are here!






Changelog September 17th



CLICK HERE TO SHOW

Poll 85 Batch 2

Players can now repair the broken bridge near Fenkenstrain's Mausoleum, creating a new shortcut to the island. You will need level 59 Construction with 12 teak planks and 56 nails. 69 Agility is required to cross the bridge afterwards. Note, you'll need to repair both sides of the bridge before you can safely cross it.
The number of Fremennik Sea Boot teleports now scales by tier: 1 → 3 → 5 → Unlimited (Easy → Medium → Hard → Elite)
Shops on desktop now include the same quantity buttons as Mobile, letting you set and left-click to buy your chosen amount.
After completing Waterfall Quest and the Kandarin Medium Diary, permanent ropes are now in place at Baxtorian Falls for easy dungeon access.
The Harmony Island herb patch is now permanently disease-free for guaranteed healthy herbs.
All Hunter Experts can now give you a one-time free Hunter Kit (across all experts) to help you get started.



Client and Mobile Updates

Mobile players can now optionally display a mobile icon by their character in the minimenu, helping others understand why you may be less responsive. The icon remains hidden in PvP areas like the Wilderness and Ferox Enclave.
Fixed visual flickering in various locations and NPCs when using the new renderer beta.
Fixed a bug where the 'Limit FPS' setting would be ignored when the game is out of focus (Desktop Official Client)
The Official Client’s AFK logout timer can now be set up to 30 minutes.
Fixed an issue on mobile which caused private chat messages and system messages to overlap the chat stone UI.



Other Changes

Hallowed Sepulchre chests now correctly drop stackable clue scrolls if you haven’t reached your clue cap.
Impling jars now only show the warning that prevents you from opening the jar if you already have a clue or scrollbox of that type on you and you’ve reached your stackable clue cap. Note, the other warning, which appears when you would receive a clue but don’t have one on you, remains unchanged.
Fixed a bug where Slayer masters weren’t respecting the 'Ignore Combat Level' setting, which could stop players from receiving tasks they were otherwise eligible for.
Fixed a bug where Slayer masters wouldn’t provide tips for Jad and Zuk tasks, leaving the advice dialogue blank.
Some typos have been fixed in clan broadcasts.



PvP Rota

The PvP rota has moved to Period A:

539 - (US) - PvP World
318 - (UK) - Bounty Hunter World
548 - (Germany) - High-Risk PvP World
577 - (US) - Free-to-Play PvP World
559 - (UK) - LMS Competitive



World 390 (AUS) for LMS Competitive has been activated with this rota.




World 569 (AUS) for Bounty Hunter has been activated with this rota.




The PvP Arena is using '1 Def Pure' loadouts in Ranked Duels and Tournaments this week.






Poll 85




More Poll 85 has arrived this week, introducing a batch of changes aimed at making your gameplay feel a bit nicer. Let's take a look at them!



Bridge Over Less Troubled Waters


Tired of that pesky broken bridge near Fenkenstrain’s Mausoleum mocking you? Well, now you can actually repair it! All it takes is 59 Construction, 12 teak planks, and 56 nails. Once built, the shortcut requires 69 Agility to cross. This should make trips to and from the area far more convenient. Be warned, though - you'll find you need to repair both sides of the bridge before you can safely cross it.





If you can’t see the image above, click here!



Fremennik Sea Boots


The teleports on the Fremennik Sea Boots now scale by Diary tier, making them more useful the further you progress. Teleports are now:

Tier 1 (Easy): 1 teleport per day
Tier 2 (Medium): 3 teleports per day
Tier 3 (Hard): 5 teleports per day
Tier 4 (Elite): Unlimited teleports




If you can’t see the image above, click here!



Desktop Shops Match Mobile


Shops on desktop now include the same quantity buttons that mobile players have enjoyed for some time. These let you set a preferred purchase or sell amount, and then buy or sell that amount with a single left-click. This should make shopping and skilling supplies much faster.





If you can’t see the image above, click here!



The Ropes are on Baxtorian Falls


Once you’ve completed both Waterfall Quest and the Kandarin Medium Diary, ropes will now be permanently secured at Baxtorian Falls. That means no more realising (after sprinting all the way there with 0 run energy left) that you left your rope in the bank, only to drift helplessly downstream in a puddle of soggy shame.





If you can’t see the image above, click here!



Harmony Island Herb Patch


The herb patch on Harmony Island is now permanently free from disease. Any herbs planted there are guaranteed to remain healthy until harvest, providing a reliable location for your herb runs.





If you can’t see the image above, click here!



Hunter Starter Pack


All Hunter Experts across Gielinor can now provide players with a one-time free Hunter Kit. This should make getting started with the skill a little easier, particularly for newer players looking to try out different Hunter tools. This applies across all experts.





If you can’t see the image above, click here!







Client and Mobile Updates




Mobile players can now choose to display a mobile icon next to their character in the minimenu. It’s a handy way to let others know you might be a little slower to type back - though don’t worry, the icon will stay hidden in PvP areas like the Wilderness and Ferox Enclave.





If you can’t see the image above, click here!





Not feeling it? You can always toggle this off in the settings menu!





If you can’t see the image above, click here!





We’ve also heard your feedback about extending this feature to other areas, like Friends Chats and Clan systems. While we can’t deliver this right away, it’s on our radar, and we’ll be looking into ways to expand it in the future!




A few other client and mobile updates this week also include:

Fixed visual flickering in various locations and NPCs when using the new renderer beta.
Fixed a bug where the 'Limit FPS' setting would be ignored when the game is out of focus (Desktop Official Client).
The Official Client’s AFK logout timer can now be set up to 30 minutes.
Fixed an issue on mobile which caused private chat messages and system messages to overlap the chat stone UI.





Other Changes



Hallowed Sepulchre chests now correctly drop stackable clue scrolls if you haven’t reached your clue cap.
Impling jars now only show the warning that prevents you from opening the jar if you already have a clue or scrollbox of that type on you and you’ve reached your stackable clue cap. Note, the other warning, which appears when you would receive a clue but don’t have one on you, remains unchanged.
Fixed a bug where Slayer masters weren’t respecting the 'Ignore Combat Level' setting, which could stop players from receiving tasks they were otherwise eligible for.
Fixed a bug where Slayer masters wouldn’t provide tips for Jad and Zuk tasks, leaving the advice dialogue blank.
Some typos have been fixed in clan broadcasts.





A Discord Community Event



A reminder for anyone who missed it last week, we'll be hosting a Chambers mass on Friday in the official OSRS Discord!





If you can’t see the image above, click here!




When? Friday, 19th September
Time? 16.00 - 17.00 BST (Mass at 15.45)
Where? World 522


What to expect?


Beautiful chaos. Piles of deaths, Olm's head almost certainly deciding to laser the entire raid at once, a few heroic clutches (probably accidental), and a tragically low number of purples.




But you can also expect plenty of laughs, some excellent stories, and that unique brand of mass-event madness that makes it all worth it. We're here for the fun - not the points (definitely not the points). Whether we walk away with loot (remember, scuffed = stuff) or just tales of chaos, we'll have a laugh together.




Not keen to be burned alive by your entire team? No worries! You can still join in by spectating - Mod Rach will be streaming her POV so you can enjoy the carnage from the safety of your bank tab.




Requirements? Nothing but a bit of Chambers knowledge, a pulse, and a willingness to die with grace would be beneficial.




So polish your pickaxes, forget your anti-venom, and let's give Olm a show we won't forget - for better or for much, much worse!






PvP World Rota




The PvP rota has moved to Period A:

539 - (US) - PvP World
318 - (UK) - Bounty Hunter World
548 - (Germany) - High-Risk PvP World
577 - (US) - Free-to-Play PvP World
559 - (UK) - LMS Competitive



World 390 (AUS) for LMS Competitive has been activated with this rota.




World 569 (AUS) for Bounty Hunter has been activated with this rota.




The PvP Arena is using '1 Def Pure' loadouts in Ranked Duels and Tournaments this week.







You can also discuss this update on the 2007Scape subreddit, the Steam forums, or the community-led OSRS Discord in the #gameupdate channel. For more info on the above content, check out the official Old School Wiki.

title: Player Support Roadmap - September Check In
content:
Earlier this year, we revealed our Player Support Roadmap – a commitment to improving support services and anti-cheating systems throughout 2025. Today, we want to share an update on progress so far, what’s next, and how this fits into the bigger future we’re building together.




Check out the video below or read on for the highlights!




If you can't see the video above, click here.



A Roadmap Shaped By Your Feedback



If you can't see the image above, click here.




Player Support is one of the areas you’ve told us matters most. That’s why we set out a clear roadmap shaped by your feedback, and why we’re now holding ourselves accountable with regular check-ins.




Since the project began, we’ve surveyed thousands of RuneScape and Old School players, helping us refine our priorities. Here's some of the wins you’ve told us you value so far:

Clearer updates and transparency from the Jagex team
Improved Contact Forms and the new My Requests feature to track tickets
Feedback when you report cheating in-game



And you’ve also told us where we still need to go further:

Realtime live chat support remains the #1 request
More transparency and flexibility in ban appeals
Faster support response times
Expanded account recovery options



We’re already working on these areas, with major updates due later this year. We’ll be checking in again with another survey in October to get your read!



Part of a Bigger Journey



These improvements are not happening in isolation. We have an ambitious vision to improve your end-to-end player experience, alongside a greater focus on integrity and fairness across our games.




By improving how we support you day to day, we’re laying the foundation for everything else to come in 2026 and beyond.






For Our Players




Player Support is an area you’ve long asked us to improve, and our Roadmap was built around your most consistently mentioned features or expectations for what good looks like.




As part of our commitment to transparency and ongoing improvements, we promised to gather feedback after major releases. Your input helps us stay accountable and makes sure we’re building the experience that matters most to you!




Following our survey in December that informed our entire project, we ran a post Roadmap survey in May 2025. We received over 5,000 responses, from a variety of active and lapsed players from both RuneScape and Old School.




There were some great things to hear we’re doing well! Some of the key highlights:

Many players appreciated clearer updates from Jagex regarding our roadmap and future plans.
The revamp of our Contact Forms and the new My Requests feature, which lets players view current and previous tickets on our Support Centre, were seen as helpful improvements.
The majority of players appreciated the new functionality that provides feedback to in-game cheating reports.



There were also some important improvements you want to see from us, all of which have even between recently released or are planned in our Roadmap for the rest of the year.

Real-time live chat support remains our most requested feature.
There was some clear frustration with the ban appeal process, with players wanting greater transparency and more flexible options for appeals.
Extended waits for support responses remained a pain point.
Some players asked for more flexible account recovery options if they’ve lost access to their account.



With some key releases on the horizon, we’ll be sending out another survey in October to check in with you – both on if you’re feeling the effects of these new releases, and to make sure we’re still prioritising what matters most!






Our Progress So Far




In the six months since we announced our Roadmap, we’re already seeing some great progress based on the features and updates that we’ve dropped so far.



Improved Player Support Response Times



We have more than doubled the size of our Player Support Team as part of our efforts to reach our 48-hour response time commitment. While this has helped, we’re not there just yet – but we’re confident we’ll get there through our larger team and other Roadmap work.



New Chat Spam Model



Our Chat Spam model launched late last year, keeping the airways clear for those proper conversations.




We’ve been continuing to refine it over 2025, leading to 17,000 chat spam bans since it launched.



Showing Reports Matter



Alongside our complex detection models, player reports are a huge help for helping us identify bad actors. It’s important we show that these reports do often result in action!




Our new Reporting system now notifies you if we’ve acted on any of your recent reports, so you can see your reports matter. To date, we’ve sent 700,000 right to player inboxes! A big thank you to everyone who uses this feature, it really helps.




If you can't see the image above, click here.



Single Point of Contact Phase 1: Single Location Tracking



We’ve launched a new system that makes it easy to open a ticket with our Player Support team, and for Jagex Accounts; track its progress all in one location. We call this our Single Point of Contact service!



Single Point of Contact Phase 2: Scaper



Our AI assistant Scaper launched last month, helping players find answers to questions they may not need a ticket to resolve. While Scaper will help plenty of requests, we’ll always let you skip the AI chit chat and open a chat or ticket with a real person if you’d prefer.




Scaper has handled over 22,000 player chats so far, with a satisfaction score of 70%. Over the next year we’ll start to explore ways for Scaper to handle self-service directly in the chat so you can instantly resolve certain support requests without the wait!



Strengthening Actions Against Bots



Since our last update, we’ve continued to strike at Botting with mass removals of accounts linked to Botters.




We’ve also made our penalties for Real World Trading significantly harsher as a deterrence for players buying gold, with a goal of reducing RWT Gold demand and the value of Botting within our games, and continue to develop further detection and removal capability.



Improved Ban Appeal Process



Most bans and mutes can be avoided by following the rules and Terms & Conditions, but if something does go wrong, we want you to feel confident that we’ll listen and review things fairly.




In our survey back in December 2024, 77% of players who appealed a ban or mute were unsatisfied with the experience. That’s why, on September 15th, we made some big improvements to our offence appeal process, with more human involvement and clearer communication.




How It Works

First appeal: Submit your appeal and a Jagex Moderator will review it, checking account ownership, looking closely at all available evidence, and removing offences caused by hijackers or applied incorrectly.
Clear explanations: If your appeal is denied, we’ll email you a more detailed explanation of the decision.
Second appeal: If you still believe the outcome is wrong, you can appeal again for a second review, following the same process.



Even past offences under 6 years old that were previously denied can be appealed again under the new system. We are unable to review bans over 6 years old due to legal requirements to delete those accounts under Data Privacy Laws and retention policies.




Every appeal is reviewed by a real person, with evidence carefully checked in two stages. While our error rate is very low, we know mistakes can happen and we’re committed to fixing them when they do. Real world trading offences have already been thoroughly checked prior to being applied, as such these appeals will only be reviewed once more.



Improved Security Defaults & Education



In our last update, we mentioned that adoption of Jagex Account security features was lower than we’d like.




Since then, we’ve been working to raise awareness with additional education and recommended changes throughout our account processes.




We’ve also disabled automatically disabling email authentication when you add another form of 2FA, providing more flexibility in how you authenticate your account.




The result of these changes has been an increase in players enabling extra security measures, which is great to see!




Remember: relying only on email codes leaves your account vulnerable if your email is ever compromised. Make sure your email is secure and add extra protections through your Jagex Account for peace of mind.



Launcher Logout Extension



Sometimes small changes can really help. We recently extended the inactivity of the log out timer on the Jagex launcher from 30 days to 90 days.




This extension means a better experience if you step away for a while but also reduces the chance of you needing to go through recovery if your old password eludes you. We hope it doesn’t, but it happens!






Pillar 1: Support Experience




The first pillar of our plans is all about providing a simple, effective and fast support experiences to you.



Live Chat Is Almost Here!



This long-requested feature is about to be real. We’re just weeks away from delivering Live Chat during peak hours with real Mods in Player Support!




To make sure we have an opportunity to learn and refine our processes, we’ll initially soft launch Live Chat soon for payment related tickets only. We’ll then begin rolling out chat for accounts management and technical help over the following month, aiming to have completed a full rollout by the end of October!



48 Hour Ticket Response Time



As we mentioned earlier, our team has more than doubled! Our Respone Times are trending down, and alongside other improvements, we aim to hit 48 Hour average ticket response time by the end of the year.




We’ve seen ticket satisfaction scores increase from 60% to 79% this year as a result of the changes we’ve already made, and we’ll continue to improve your experience, and aim to increase CSAT to consistently over the gold standard of 80%.




If you can't see the image above, click here.






Pillar 2: Account Issues & Security




The second pillar of our plans are all about keeping your accounts safe and giving you greater control.



Hijacking Protection



In the Dec 2024 survey, 87% of players wanted Jagex to lock their account if hijacked so they can recover it.




As a result, we’re developing a new detection model designed to identify when an account may have been hijacked. At first, this system will notify players via email when suspicious activity is detected. Soon, it will go further by locking accounts to kick out hijackers.




To support this, we’ve improved the “End all sessions” function. Previously, ending sessions would log you out of websites but wouldn’t remove your character from the game instantly.




Now, when you hit End all sessions in your account settings, your character is immediately logged out of RuneScape, Old School RuneScape, the Launcher and our Website.




From there, you’ll need to re-authenticate before getting back into the game, ensuring that only you can regain access.



Launcher Security Updates



We’ll be releasing a brand-new Security tab in the Jagex Launcher. If your account is missing important protections, such as a TOTP authenticator app or backup codes, this tab will pop up to encourage you to secure your account.



Account Recovery



Finally, we know account recovery is one of the most critical aspects of Player Support. We’re currently designing a smoother, more secure recovery process to help you get back into your account safely if the worst happens.




This is a complex piece of work, so we want to make sure we get it right. Expect to hear more in future roadmap updates.



Jagex Account Pain Points



We’ve been working on addressing Jagex Account pain points across multiple areas and platforms based on your feedback.




Mobile Character Switching is on the way, due to be released before the end of this year.




We're also still on track to improve the elevated permissions issue by the end of this year. Players should see an improvement to installing the Launcher on devices without admin access for RuneScape and Old School via RuneLite. This will help you install some of our clients on public computers, such as in the library or workplace, for those extra XP gains!




We continue to invest in ensuring our games are accessible for as many people to play as possible. For our Linux players, we’re actively investigating bringing the Launcher to Linux platforms. While we don’t have any specific updates today, it’s still on our radar.




There are also planned improvements on Mac. We’re committed to ensuring Mac players aren’t impacted by the upcoming deprecation of Rossetta 2 in coming years. For those users playing on Apple Silicon Mac devices, we will be providing a native build of the Launcher and games that supports this architecture, in ample time of the deprecation.




We’ll also be improving your experience by giving flexibility to change the behaviour of various aspects of the Launcher, first being the close button, coming soon.



Jagex Launcher & Account Reliability



In our December 2024 survey, around half of Legacy account players said they were hesitant to switch because they’d seen Jagex Account users run into Launcher login issues.




Since then, we’ve rolled out optimisations that make the Launcher run smoother and more reliably during those busy spikes around big updates. We’re pleased to report there were no performance issues during significant launches – like the Varlamore update in July or the RuneScape Leagues launch on September 15th.






Pillar 3: Cheating Detection & Removal




Our third pillar is about keeping the game fair for everyone.




We know dealing with Bots and Cheaters is of huge importance to the community – and it is to us too. There’s been huge amount of time and effort put into this area over the past few months, and we are far from done.



New Bot Detection Models



While we can’t go into details on this one to avoid tipping off Botters, we are investing in our technology and detection methods to better identify and flag Bot accounts to be banned.



Real World Trading



To further deter Botters, we’re also improving our ability to tackle likely Real World Trading – and in combination with our harsher penalties, ensure we continue to deter both buyers and sellers of RWT gold as much as possible.






Our Next Updates




Player Support matters, and we know it’s something you’ve long wanted to see improved.




We want you to feel the effects of all these improvements across a ton of areas, and we know some of your most desired features are still to come – like better cheating detection, Live Chat for all tickets, and more flexibility in Account Recovery.




There’s plenty still ahead of us to deliver on, and we’ll keep you updated every step of the way. Expect further news in the coming months as these features go live!




Thank you for your continued support and feedback along this journey. See you in Gielinor.





Jagex Player Support

title: Interface Uplift
content:
Known Issues	Status
We’re aware that the Bounty Hunter worlds did not rotate as expected this week. Apologies for the mix-up! They will revert to their correct rotation in next week’s update, switching over to the expected Rotation B.	Coldfixed.
We’re aware that the new Set Effect bonus isn’t fully working for Virtus.	Coldfixed.






The first batch of Interface Uplift hits this week - Smarter cannonballs, better alerts, and easier world hopping for activities.






Changelog September 24th



CLICK HERE TO SHOW

Interface Uplift Changes

You can now set a custom amount of cannonballs to load into your Dwarven multicannon with a new 'Load-X' option, helping you avoid waste while grinding. This value can be customised in the settings menu.
When your prayer is drained at Barrows, a chat message will now appear alongside the floating face effect to make it clearer what’s happening.
Chugging barrels can now pull potions directly from both your bank and potion storage when loading, with a new bank setting to control this behaviour.
Added a 'Bank all' button to the Theatre of Blood death chest.
Added a toggleable setting to toggle a warning when depositing high-value seeds into a birdhouse on Fossil Island.
The Set Effects menu now shows bonuses from each piece of an outfit, as well as the full set bonus.
Converted the Grouping tab's 'Suggested world' section into a button so that players can easily hop to the suggested world for a given activity.



Other Changes

Fire and Infernal capes will now keep their fiery textures when teleporting, instead of briefly swapping to a static version.
Fixed the Slayer cape perk so players can now get back-to-back Zuk tasks as intended.
Fixed some blocked ground near Taverley that was stopping players from walking through.
The four bandana eyepatches can now be used for a clue that requires a bandana.
Bandana eyepatches once again have the correct colour inventory icon.
The ring of stone, and similar items, no longer break you out of being tethered to scenery at Tempoross.
The new icon that denotes mobile users is now automatically hidden in the Bounty Hunter lobby area.




PSA: We’re aware that the Bounty Hunter worlds did not rotate as expected this week. Apologies for the mix-up! They will revert to their correct rotation in next week’s update, switching over to the expected Rotation B.




The PvP rota has moved to Period A:

539 - (US) - PvP World
318 - (UK) - Bounty Hunter World
548 - (Germany) - High-Risk PvP World
577 - (US) - Free-to-Play PvP World
559 - (UK) - LMS Competitive



World 390 (AUS) for LMS Competitive has been activated with this rota.




World 569 (AUS) for Bounty Hunter has been activated with this rota.




The PvP Arena is using '1 Def Pure' loadouts in Ranked Duels and Tournaments this week.






Interface Uplift Changes




This week brings in the first batch of changes from our Interface Uplift blog. Let's take a look!



Chugging Barrel Improvements


Tired of jumping back and forth between your Bank and Potion Storage just to top up your Chugging Barrel? We hear you. Now, when you hit the 'Load' button, your barrel can snatch potions from both your Bank and Potion Storage at the same time - no interface gymnastics required.





If you can’t see the image above, click here!





There’s even a new bank setting so you can decide whether your barrel raids both storages or just the one you’ve got open. To keep things crystal clear, chat messages will tell you exactly how many doses came from each spot - so more potions, less clicking!





If you can’t see the image above, click here!



Multi Cannon


Ever wish you could load your Dwarven Multicannon with just the right number of cannonballs without wasting a single one? Now you can! The new 'Load-X' option lets you pick exactly how many cannonballs to feed your cannon, so you can go full-on siege mode, or just tickle a few mobs. Handy in spots where you place a cannon to pull in agression, but are otherwise barraging down stacks - such as Smoke Devils.





If you can’t see the image above, click here!





Want to change your default load? No problem - the amount can be customised right in the settings menu. Boom.





If you can’t see the image above, click here!



Barrows Prayer


Nothing ruins a Barrows run faster than not noticing your Prayer getting sapped by those spooky brothers. To save you from accidentally running dry, we’ve added a chat message that pops up whenever your Prayer is drained - right alongside the classic floating face effect.





If you can’t see the image above, click here!





Now it’s crystal clear when your Prayer’s taking a hit, so you can react faster and keep that HP from falling.



Bank All Your Shame at ToB


Dying in the Theatre of Blood is never fun, but reclaiming your loot just got a little less soul-crushing. The ToB death chest now has a Bank all button.




Simply unlock your chest, hit the button, and all items will be sent straight to your bank in one click. Perfect for when you want to rage quit with feeling.





If you can’t see the image above, click here!



Birdhouse Seed Warning


Accidentally chucking high-value seeds into your Fossil Island birdhouses? Ouch. To save your GP from flying away, we’ve added a toggleable warning when depositing seeds above a value you choose. Head into the settings menu to turn the warning on and set your personal threshold.





If you can’t see the image above, click here!





When you try to plonk in a pricey seed, a friendly chat message will pop up, making sure you’re really, really sure before you commit.





If you can’t see the image above, click here!





Now your birdhouses can stay full without your bank taking a hit!



See Every Bonus, Big or Small


Ever worn a piece of Inquisitor’s armour and wondered if that tiny 0.5% damage and accuracy boost was really doing anything? Or if your Graceful boots were actually helping with run energy? We’ve fixed that.




The Set Effects menu now shows the bonuses from each individual piece of an outfit, as well as the full set bonus if you’ve got the whole thing equipped. Whether you’re rocking partial Inquisitor’s, Graceful, or one of the many skilling or combat outfits with tiered bonuses, you can now see exactly what each piece is contributing.





If you can’t see the image above, click here!





No more guessing - your stats window now tells the whole story. Equip your gear, check your boosts, and feel smug about every little bonus you earn.



Suggested Worlds Made Clickable


Tired of manually switching worlds for your favourite minigames? Now, on the Grouping tab, the suggested world for each activity is a clickable button.





If you can’t see the image above, click here!





Click it, confirm the prompt, and you’re in the recommended world without any extra fiddling. Whether you’re heading to Fishing Trawler, Barbarian Assault, or any other activity with a suggested world, hop to it!







Other Changes



Fire and Infernal capes will now keep their fiery textures when teleporting, instead of briefly swapping to a static version.
Fixed the Slayer cape perk so players can now get back-to-back Zuk tasks as intended.
Fixed some blocked ground near Taverley that was stopping players from walking through.
The four bandana eyepatches can now be used for a clue that requires a bandana.
Bandana eyepatches once again have the correct colour inventory icon.
The ring of stone, and similar items, no longer break you out of being tethered to scenery at Tempoross.
The new icon that denotes mobile users is now automatically hidden in the Bounty Hunter lobby area.





PvP World Rota




PSA: We’re aware that the Bounty Hunter worlds did not rotate as expected this week. Apologies for the mix-up! They will revert to their correct rotation in next week’s update, switching over to the expected Rotation B.




The PvP rota has moved to Period A:

539 - (US) - PvP World
318 - (UK) - Bounty Hunter World
548 - (Germany) - High-Risk PvP World
577 - (US) - Free-to-Play PvP World
559 - (UK) - LMS Competitive



World 390 (AUS) for LMS Competitive has been activated with this rota.




World 569 (AUS) for Bounty Hunter has been activated with this rota.




The PvP Arena is using '1 Def Pure' loadouts in Ranked Duels and Tournaments this week.










You can also discuss this update on the 2007Scape subreddit, the Steam forums, or the community-led OSRS Discord in the #gameupdate channel. For more info on the above content, check out the official Old School Wiki.

The Old School Team.

title: Last Chance For Official Makeship Plushies!
content:
Time is running out to get your hands on the latest official Old School RuneScape x Makeship plushies!

Our cute critters range spans four iconic NPCs such as Zanik, Thurgo, the Varrock Stray Dog and a Varlamore Capybara.

There is only 1 week left to order these limited-edition plushies.

You have until October 4th 8:00am UTC, 4am ET, 1am PT and 6pm AET to purchase them on Makeship's website here.







If you can’t see the image above, click here.




LAST CHANCE FOR MAKESHIP CUTE CRITTERS PLUSHIES





Zanik



If you can’t see the image above, click here.




If you can’t see the image above, click here.




Zanik: I am a goblin!




She’s your adorable cave goblin pal and the chosen commander of Bandos himself – and now she’s in plush form! That’s right, for a limited time you can get your hands on your very own cuddly Zanik. Introduce her to your fellow surface-dwellers or infiltrate your local cult with the help of her H.A.M. robes and trusty crossbow. Pre-order yours here.



Thurgo



If you can’t see the image above, click here.




If you can’t see the image above, click here.




You see Thurgo's eyes light up.




This snuggly version of everyone’s favourite smith might not be able to make you a Blurite Sword, but he can give you a big strong cuddle! Don’t worry – Thurgo comes with his very own Redberry Pie, so he’ll be perfectly content sat on your shelf. Pre-order yours here.



Stray Dog



If you can’t see the image above, click here.




Woof!




He’s followed you all over Varrock, and now the Stray Dog wants to follow you home… in plush form! With a big bag of plushie bones to snack on, we’re sure he’ll settle right in. Could you be his forever home? This official Old School RuneScape plush is only available for a limited time – get one now, before he wanders off again! Pre-order yours here.



Capybara



If you can’t see the image above, click here.




The capybara uses its nose to roll an orange towards you.




You’ve seen these cuddly creatures getting up to all kinds of mischief in Varlamore, and now you can snuggle your very own Capybara – in plush form! Each Capybara plush also comes with its own fashionscape, in the form of a funky orange stuck on its head. Aww! Pre-order yours here.





If you can’t see the image above, click here.

These official Old School RuneScape plushies are only available for a limited time, so go and get one now from Makeship before the campaign ends on October 4th!




Plus, make sure to sign up to Makeship's emails to be the first to know about new Old School RuneScape plushies and products coming in the future!








You can also discuss this merch release on the 2007Scape subreddit, the Steam forums, or the community-led OSRS Discord.
