title: Introducing Poll System Improvements
content:
We’re revamping our Poll system to be better than ever!

If you can't see this image, click here!

Polls have always been the backbone of Old School RuneScape, giving you the final say on what content makes it into the game and making sure it stays true to the spirit of Old School. It is one of the most unique things about OSRS. Truly, this is democracy manifest!

The system has served us well over the years, but it is also a little limited. Until now, we have only been able to ask very simple, tick-box questions, and even then, we have been tied up by the tech behind the system. We know that sometimes this left us unable to get a full picture of how the community was feeling about an idea.

That is why we are expanding what the Poll System can do. These changes will not affect the Polling Charter or the 70% pass rate, that core principle remains untouched. Instead, we are giving ourselves more ways to hear from you, to test the waters before big decisions, and to make sure your feedback is shaping the game at every step.

So, let’s dive into the improvements that will make polling more flexible, more engaging, and more informative than ever before.

Why The Change?

What do we mean when we talk about the Poll system being limited?

Question types are limited: We can only ask simple, single-choice questions, which means feedback is often too black-and-white.
Poll timing is clunky: Launching or closing a poll requires certain developers with specific access to be online at the right moment. On top of that, we can only run one poll at a time. Some updates have been pushed back because we simply can't poll what is required for the time it'd be ready for release.
Survey fatigue is real: When we need deeper insight we sometimes send out external surveys, but these can often suffer from fewer responses the more we send, and it's not ideal having to pull people away from the game.

The new system addresses all of these problems. It makes polling more flexible, more accessible, and more player-friendly.

What’s New In The Improved Poll System?
New Question Types

We can now go far beyond simple Yes/No. Examples include:

Single-choice

Same as before, but still essential for Yes/No decisions.

Question 1: Same as before, but still essential for Yes/No decisions.

  Yes
  No
  Skip
Multiple-choice

Pick several options from a list, perfect for things like “Which of these rewards interest you most?”.

Question 2: Which themes would you like for a future cape design? (Choose up to 2).

  Completionist Cape
  More Max Cape Variants
  Third option (C)
  Fourth option (D)
Free-text

Type your own response directly in-game, useful for gathering opinions in your own words.

Question 3: Explain why you will never be able to defeat Cuthbert, Lord of Dread.

Type Your Answer:  
Ranked

Sort a list by preference, e.g. which skills or features should we prioritise.

Question 4: Rank your favourite Lil' Zik Transmogs.

Maiden
Bloat
Nylo
Sot
Xarp
Matrix

Answer a set of related questions at once, like rating different aspects of an idea.

Question 5: Rate each Sailing training method on a scale from “strongly dislike” to “strongly like.”

	Strongly like	Like	Neutral	Dislike	Strongly dislike	Skip
Courier Tasks	
	
	
	
	
	

Bounty Tasks	
	
	
	
	
	

Sea Charting	
	
	
	
	
	

Shipwreck salvaging	
	
	
	
	
	

Barracuda Trials	
	
	
	
	
	

These new question types mean we can get a fuller picture of how you feel and why.

Poll Formatting

If you can't see this image, click here!

Polls can now include in-game text blocks, images, headers, and even links that take you to blogs or bigger design explanations. This means we can provide more context directly inside the poll menu without you always needing to leave the game.

Different Poll Types

If you can't see this image, click here!

Not everything has to be a formal Yes/No vote. We now have the ability to run:

Lock-in polls: A lock-in poll is a commitment to release the proposed update if it reaches the usual 70% pass and remains reasonably possible for us to ship. If we hit problems during development, we may change or cancel the update, and we will explain why if that happens.
Greenlight polls: A greenlight poll asks whether we should explore the idea further. If it reaches the usual 70% pass, we will develop a fuller design and bring it back via a lock-in poll so you can decide whether to commit to it being added to the game.
Examples: "Do you want Raids 4, details will be revealed at a later date, and rewards will be polled separately" this would be considered to be a Lock-in poll rather than greenlight, as it has been in the past. A typical Greenlight poll might instead look like "Should we explore adding a new area to the game themed around cabbages?" - the emphasis on exploring adding something that is not fully fleshed out, but will give us a good indication on whether or not you feel like it's worth us spending time refining an idea further before we fully commit to adding it to the game via a Lock-in poll.
Opinion surveys: Flexible questionnaires that let us gather input before content is ready to share for wider feedback.

These two new poll types are especially useful for early-stage designs, where we’d rather hear your thoughts first before locking anything in!

Eligibility

By default, polls will still require members with 25 hours of playtime and 300 total levels. But now we have tools to refine eligibility for specific polls or even specific questions.

For example, we might want feedback from players of a certain combat level, or restrict a question to players who’ve engaged with a particular piece of content. These are mainly going to be used for opinion-based polls or survey questions, rather than content than might be coming into the game.

If we feel there is a need for addition requirements to vote on a particular poll question, we will use this with care. We’d like to share our thoughts on how we believe it will work:

Default stays broad: Content polls that add to the game will continue to follow the standard rules, including the 70% pass requirement and the usual account eligibility. Targeting is mainly for opinion polls or surveys where specialist input helps.
Ways for everyone to be heard: When we target a question to specialists, we will look to pair it with a wider opinion poll, a free-text question, or a survey open to a broader audience. This helps us capture both expert experience and general sentiment.
Clear reasons, shared in advance: If we plan to restrict a poll or a question, we will say so before it goes live. We will explain who is eligible, how the criteria work, and why this approach is better for that case. For example, we may ask only players with experience of a boss to rate its drop table, while still running a separate opinion poll open to everyone.
Simple, game-relevant criteria: Criteria will be based on in-game progress you can understand and verify, such as a quest completed, kill count, total level, league rank, or a recent activity flag.
Not a blanket change: We are still exploring the best use cases. Targeted questions will be the exception, not the rule. We will review results and share a short note on who was eligible and why, so the process is clear.
Example you might see in-game: This question is visible to players with at least 10 Vorkath kills. We are using this criterion to collect feedback from players familiar with the fight. A separate opinion poll on Vorkath is open to all players.
Running Multiple Polls

The new system lets us run more than one poll at a time, something we couldn’t do before. That means smaller, targeted polls won’t need to wait for the big headline content polls to finish.

Automation and Scheduling

It will be possible for Polls to be scheduled in advance, opening and closing automatically. This removes the need for manual intervention and ensures everything runs on time. It also means we can tease polls early by making them visible in the game before voting begins!

A New Look For Web & A More Robust System!

While the poll section on the Old School website holds a lot of nostalgic charm, is has been well overdue a revamp, which includes presenting the results in the same way the game does! No more inconsistencies with voting %'s as we'll finally be counting skip votes in the results displayed! Hurrah!

In addition to this, the new system is much more robust! While there have only been a small number of occasions where poll data became corrupted due to unforeseen circumstances (requiring us to re-run a poll entirely!), the new system is far more robust with the data consistency which will help alleviate the chances of that happening.

Looking Ahead

That is everything we are ready to share for now. The improved Poll System gives us the tools to gather your thoughts in more meaningful ways, while still holding onto the principle that has defined Old School since 2013: if it is coming into the game, it needs 70% of your votes.

With these changes, you will see more variety in the kinds of questions we ask, more opportunities to share your views, and smoother processes behind the scenes to make sure polls run on time. From opinion polls that test early ideas, to flexible question types that go beyond a simple “yes or no,” this is about giving you more ways to shape the game you love.

What's even more exciting is that we're also going to be bringing in all the data from previous polls, meaning you will have the power to see what you voted for in each one! Have fun going back in time and seeing how past you voted!

Mod Lykos
Because polls have been so important to OSRS's history, we wanted to make sure we did them justice. We think there's a subset of long-time players that will really get a kick out of going through the older ones and seeing what they had voted for (or against) at the time.

We are excited to roll out the new system soon and cannot wait to see what you think of it. As always, keep an eye on the News page and our socials for details on when the first improved poll will go live, and be ready to make your voice heard!

You can also discuss this update on the 2007Scape subreddit, the Steam forums, or the community-led OSRS Discord in the #gameupdate channel. For more info on the above content, check out the official Old School Wiki.

title: Grid Master - Out Today!
content:
Known Issues	Status
We are aware that for some players the Gemstone Crab on Grid Master won't bury, meaning the task can't be completed.	We've put a hotfix live that in the short-term, has reduced the amount of players who receive the message to 100. We will continue to work on removing the cap gradually. Thanks for your patience.
Some players are currently unable to hand in the four decorations to Fred during the Halloween event.	Hotfixed. If you have been affected prior to the fix, you can resolve this by deleting the painting and obtaining a new one from Seth to continue your progress.
We are aware that the Spooky Chair can be brought into the Gauntlet.	Hotfixed.
   

Old School’s first community event is here: Grid Master awaits! Dive in, climb the ranks, but don't forget to stop by Lumbridge for some Halloween antics with Fred the Farmer!

Changelog
Click Here To Show
Grid Master
Grid Master is here! Start your journey off by selecting one of the worlds marked in green on the World Select page!
Halloween
The Halloween event has arrived. Speak to Fred the Farmer by visiting his farmhouse, located northwest of Lumbridge, to get started!
Client & Mobile
We’ve smoothed out visual flickering and layering issues on the new renderer beta across several areas and NPCs, including Darkmeyer, Slepe, the Desert, and more.
Other Changes
Fixed an issue where Bloodveld and Nechryael tasks could be assigned without completing Priest in Peril.
Fixed an issue where Partner slayer didn’t properly respect quest requirements - it should now work as intended.
Fixed an issue where Dragon tasks incorrectly required full completion of Dragon slayer - they now only require it to be started.
Players can once again pick up food from the floor in free to play worlds and the Bounty hunter crater - these areas were unintentionally affected by recent wilderness changes.
Using the new hat retrieval menu on Rantz will now add the hats to the collection log. Any hats collected through this menu over the past few weeks will be added to the collection log and trigger any achievement diary task completion on login.
Order has been restored to the spelling of 'Chaos fanatic' in the rune pouch load-out menu.
The world map hotkey tooltip has been mildly shortened and will no longer show if you've toggled it off.
Looting the Moon chest from now on will no longer attribute the loot to Tormented demons.
Grammar corrections have been made to Ava's and Azzanadra's dialogue.
PvP Rota

The PvP rota has moved to Period B

560 - (UK) - PvP World

World 569 (AUS) for Bounty Hunter has been de-activated with this rota.

The PvP Arena is using 'Max/Med' loadouts in Ranked Duels and Tournaments this week.

Grid Master

Today's the day for Grid Master's launch, Old School RuneScape's very first community event! Keep an eye on the Get Ready For Grid Master! newspost, as there might be some more small teasers coming before launch!

If you're looking for our launch plan times, we've got them right here:

If you need a quick refresher on what Grid Master is and how to play, then check out the fantastic video from JoshIsntGaming below:

If you can't see the video above, click here!

The Grid

We'll be releasing the full Grid just before the event starts, so keep an eye on the Wiki page to get the full breakdown! But, just incase you've missed it, here are the current roster of tiles revealed:

If you can't see the image above, click here!

If you can't see the image above, click here!

   
Relic Design Race Competition

In the spirit of our very first community event, we're also here with first-of-its-kind competition...

The first three players to fully complete the grid will have a chance to work with us to create a brand new Relic for the upcoming Leagues VI.

We're excited to see you think on the fly and push to become the grid's masters - get that podium finish!

For full details and to check if you're eligible to participate, check out T&Cs for more info!!




Finally, we wanted to say good luck and have fun to everyone hoping into Grid Master, we'll see you there!

Halloween 2025

Golden crispy leaves outside the window, Pumpkin Spice drinks buffing your IRL Warmth Meter, jack-o-lanterns slowly spawning on doorsteps... Autumn has already worked its magic, and now the Spooktober vibe has hit Gielinor, too!

Not a bad doggo >:( Just a bat doggo ^.^
If you can't see the image above, click here!

Getting the Event Started

Talking of Halloween-themed house decorations popping up everywhere... Apparently Death, the Grim Reaper himself, is hosting the Spook-a-thon Decoration Contest. Fred has signed up and wants to turn his humble home into a full-on spook fest, but he gravely needs your help to do so. Help him if you dare...

If you can't see the image above, click here!

To start this year's Halloween Event, speak to Fred the Farmer by visiting his farmhouse north-west of Lumbridge.

If you can't see the image above, click here!

Rewards

As always, once you complete the quest, there are some wicked rewards up for grabs!

Spooky Chair

Remember those spooky chairs at the Draynor Manor moving on their own as if they're possessed? Now you can summon one of those to follow you around for a little while! Not to be confused with a pet though, it will tag along with you for around 10 seconds once you click the "Drop" option on the chair in your inventory. But you may still have a spooky feeling like you're being followed...

If you can't see the image above, click here!

Chair Spinner

Similar to above, the spooky chair will go full spinny and cursed if you use the "Spin" option on the chair in your inventory.

If you can't see the image above, click here!

Grim Reaper Outfit

Currently, the Grim Reaper Hood already exists in-game, but it doesn't have a matching complete outfit. Tut tut tut, that's about to change! You can now complete your killer fashionscape with the Grim Reaper Top, Grim Reaper Bottom and Grim Reaper Gloves.

If you can't see the image above, click here!

Don't have the Grim Reaper Hood? No worries, all the rewards from previous Halloween events, including the hood, can still be unlocked. Just speak to Diango in Draynor to claim them!

Spooky Pumpkin Lantern

What more do we need to say? The previous image says it all. It wouldn't be Halloween without a new spooky jack-o-lantern you can haunt the streets of Gielinor with...

Halloween Livestream

If you can't see the image above, click here!

Tomorrow, October 16th 3pm UTC, following the event release, we'll be hosting a Halloween livestream, consisting of:

Spooky Parade: Put on the spooky fashionscape of your choice and meet us outside the Draynor Manor garden at 3pm UTC on World 520!
The parade will be led by Mod Rach who will also be on screen for her livestream debut! Come say hi and give her a warm welcome!
JMods Draw - Halloween Edition: We're continuing our JMods Draw tradition, but with a Halloween twist. Mods West and Jerv will be sharing their designs inspired by your suggestions in the #jmods-draw-halloween channel on Discord. Reminder that this is purely for funsies only.
Pumpkin Carving Competition Finals: We'll be voting on finalist entries of the Pumpkin Carving Competition on Twitch chat and your votes will determine the winners!
Mass Corps Event in Spooky Fashionscape: At the end of the stream, we’ll also do a mass Corporeal Beast run in all its chaos, befitting Halloween. Put on your most Halloween inspired outfits and meet Mod Manked at the entrance of Corporeal Beast’s lair (this is not a lure, we promise... Use the Games Necklace to teleport to the entrance of the lair) on World 519. If you wanna go for DPS gear instead, go ahead - you do you! Any fashionscape/gear preference is welcome.

If you can't see the image above, click here!

Halloween Discord Banner Competition

If you can't see the image above, click here!

Calling all artsy 'Scapers to grind an IRL skill this time: Draw a Halloween-themed, OSRS-inspired Discord banner, and drop it at the #halloween-banner channel on our Discord. If you get the W, you'll:

Have your banner displayed on our official Discord until November 1st!
Grab 3 months of OSRS membership

If you can't see the image above, click here!

Banner requirements

Size: 960 x 540 pixels with an aspect ratio of 16:9
Formats: PNG or JPG
Max file size: 10 MB

You have until Sunday, October 19th 9am UTC to submit your design, so get started if you haven't already! We're looking forward to seeing what you talented lot come up with!

Check out the T&Cs here.

Today is the anniversary of when the Max Cape was first added to game back in 2015! To celebrate, we are restocking a host of max cape variants on the merch store. Mastery in keyring form, customized to your in game achievements!

Check out all the variants available here, and don't forget the OG as well!

JMod Wars

Join us for another round of JMod Castle Wars action!

If you can't see the image above, click here!

When?

Friday, October 24th
4:00-5:00 PM BST (Massing from 3:45 PM – be ready! 14.45 UTC / 10.45 ET / 07:45 PT / 01:45 AET)

Where?

The official OSRS Discord - Streamed on a stage for anyone who wants to just watch the chaos!
World 522

What?

We're flipping your classic Castle Wars experience on its head and unleashing some chaos.

Two J-Mods, Mod Nerco and Mod Rach, will join the fray as each team's unkillable, flag-thieving behemoths. These aren’t just mascots… they’re mobile mega Mods with 1,000,000 Hit points and a dream!

The plan?

As soon as the game starts, the enemy J-Mod will teleport into your base to steal your flag. Your team must stop them at all costs, while also escorting your own J-Mod and their mountain of hitpoints back to safety. The JMods will have a few tricks up their sleeve - so watch out.

Bring your gear, bring your A-game, and get ready for the most absurd Castle Wars match you’ve ever seen!
